page.title: 10 A GAME OF SKITTLES
page.content: {Skittles}is a team game that is played during the winter in the alleys of most{pubs}in West Somerset. A team normally has 6 players who choose their own team name. There are 3 hard wooden balls and 9 skittles which are put in a diamond pattern at the end of the alley. The balls are used to knock the skittles or pins over. To score the ball must hit the 'Plate' at the throwing end. Some names used in the game are very strange. A 'Sergeant Major' means you count the lowest score of a player if someone is away. If you hit a 'Flopper' all the pins fall down with one ball. If you score 9 points with two balls then you have a 'spare' and you can stick all the skittles back up and throw again. A 'Sticker Up' is paid to do this for you. If the ball hits the side of the alley it is called a 'Banker'.
